New York University Archives
Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper Collection on New York University Summer School
Carper, Virginia Nelson Speiden
Dellinger, Mary Helen
MC.264
.25 linear feet in 1 half manuscript box
1931 Materials are in English. Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper (1908-2005) was from Manassas, Virginia and the daughter of architect Albert Speiden. In 1931 she attended New York University Summer School to study music education. This collection consists of materials collected by Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper documenting her attendance at NYU in the summer of 1931. Materials in this collection include correspondence regarding classes and accommodations, a lecture outline for a class on music education, a map of New York City, a copy of The Summer School News, a program for "Philadelphia in Music: Past and Present," Pullman Company passenger car fare checks, receipts, and newspaper clippings. The collection also includes documents from Hotel Judson, which hosted summer school students. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access. 1
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of materials collected by Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper documenting her attendance at New York University's Summer School in 1931. Materials in this collection include correspondence regarding classes and accommodations, a lecture outline for a class on music education, a map of New York City, a copy of The Summer School News, a program for "Philadelphia in Music: Past and Present," Pullman Company passenger car fare checks, receipts, and newspaper clippings. The collection also includes documents from Hotel Judson, which hosted summer school students.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Mary Helen Dellinger in May, 2016; the accession associated with this gift is 2019.032.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Virginia Nelson Speiden Carter Collection of Materials on New York University Summer School; MC 264; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in an archival box and folders, and described on the collection-level.
Biographical Note
Virginia Nelson Speiden Carper (1908-2005) was from Manassas, Virginia and the daughter of architect Albert Speiden. In 1931 she attended NYU Summer School to study music education.
Education, Higher. Dellinger, Mary Helen New York University. Summer School
